narrative: Maya was walking on the beach when she saw something that made her heart race.
A young dolphin was lying on the sand, breathing hard and looking really scared.
Maya knew she had to help... and fast!

options.text: Run to get her friends Sam and Alex
Pour seawater on the dolphin to keep it wet

consequences.text: Sam and Alex came running when Maya called. 'We'll help!' they said.
Maya gently splashed cool water on the dolphin. It seemed to feel a little better.

continuation: Working together, the friends kept the dolphin calm and wet while Sam called for help on his phone.
Soon, some adults came to help them carry the dolphin back to the water.
The dolphin swam away strong and free! Maya felt amazing - she had saved a life.

reflections.question: Have you ever helped an animal that was in trouble? How did it make you feel?
What could you do to help protect ocean animals?

narrative: Maya was enjoying a peaceful walk along the beach when she spotted something totally scary.
A dolphin lay stranded on the sand, breathing really fast and shallow.
The morning sun was getting hot, and Maya realized this beautiful creature was in serious danger.

options.text: Get Sam and Alex to help immediately
Keep the dolphin's skin wet with seawater

consequences.text: Sam and Alex arrived quickly, ready to help with the rescue mission.
Maya carefully poured seawater over the dolphin, and its breathing seemed to slow down a bit.

continuation: Sam called the marine rescue hotline while Alex helped Maya keep the dolphin comfortable.
Maya spoke softly to the animal, trying to keep it calm.
When the rescue team arrived, they worked together to guide the dolphin back into the waves.
The dolphin paused for a moment at the water's edge... as if saying thank you... before swimming strongly back to the deep ocean.

reflections.question: When you see someone or something in trouble, what helps you stay calm and think clearly?
How could you learn more about helping marine animals in your area?

narrative: Maya was exploring a quiet part of the beach when something urgent happened right in front of her.
A young dolphin had washed up on the sand, breathing hard and its skin starting to dry out in the sun.
Maya knew that dolphins could get really sick if they stayed out of water too long.

choice_points.question: How should Maya start this rescue?

options.text: Work with Sam and Alex as a rescue team
Start keeping the dolphin wet right away to buy some time

consequences.text: Sam and Alex answered Maya's call, bringing extra hands and smart thinking to help with the emergency.
Maya's quick water-splashing helped the dolphin stay stable while she figured out what to do next.

continuation: Maya organized everything: keeping the dolphin wet, checking that it was breathing okay, and making sure someone called the professional marine rescuers.
The team worked super efficiently, knowing that every minute really mattered.
When the rescue experts arrived with the right equipment, they successfully got the dolphin back to deeper water.
The dolphin's powerful tail made happy splashes as it disappeared under the surface... finally home again in the ocean!

reflections.question: How do you handle stressful situations where you need to think fast and work with others?
What steps could you take to get better at helping wildlife emergencies in your area?
